title: Quintet 2014 Flanerie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Here on display are all the elegance, finesse and ultimate power possible in wines from this exceptional AVA. Tart raspberry fruit, stiff tannins and supporting acids are nuanced with citrus, herb and a light touch of vanilla. Drink this from 2020 to 2030.

title: Stolo 2014 Creekside Estate Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: There's a beechwood smoke touch to the nose of this bottling, accenting a core of dried purple flowers and black raspberry. It's well integrated on the palate, where smoke and dark, tangy fruit mix with white pepper and an acidity that carries its flavors into the finish.

title: Rocca delle Macìe 2013 Riserva di Fizzano Single Vineyard Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this elegant, structured wine opens with spicy red berry and underbrush notes with a hint of toast. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and mocha flavors, framed by assertive but polished tannins. Drink 2018–2025.
designation: Riserva di Fizzano Single Vineyard Gran Selezione

title: Losada 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Losada is known for its red Mencía, but this Godello debut is well done. A waxy floral nose with apple and stone-fruit aromas sets up a round full balanced palate with bold acidity. Salty notes accent peach and apple flavors, while this displays grip on a lingering finish. Sophisticated is a good way to describe this.

title: Pietroso 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: You'll find ripe plum, forest floor, exotic spice, menthol and espresso aromas in this structured red. The palate is bright and linear with youthful tension, delivering red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and anise notes set against compact, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Pine Ridge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a silky-smooth and integrated wine, with firm, structured tannins that provide support without distracting. A wealth of brawny baked berry, tar and chocolate flavors reveal themselves over time, while subtle, deep clove and dried herb scents lie beneath.

title: Gainey 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A solid Pinot Noir for its price, this offers all the expected flavors and strikes a balance between richness and freshness. Wild cherry, anise, sagebrush and slate aromas lead into a palate that packs ripe red fruit upfront, followed by tangy elderberry, plum skin, hibiscus and rose. A touch of elderflower adds depth.

title: Hunt & Ryde 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: In its second vintage, this wine is light and spicy, clearly made to be enjoyed with food. A collaborative effort between winemaker Guy Davis and proprietor/grapegrower and chef Guy Fieri, it shines in subtly toasty oak, cinnamon and dark cherry flavors, with a lingering lushness on the finish.

title: Kokomo 2014 Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light in color yet meaty on the palate, this is a youthful, tightly-wound red, firm in tannin and oak. The fruit profile is subtle, allowing spicier characteristics of cardamom and clove to shine.

title: Fesstivity 2014 Brut Rosé (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is the second vintage of sparkling wine production for winemaker Blair Fox but the first he's controlled from start to finish, and the early results are exciting. Zesty lime, graphite and raspberry scents lead the nose, while red plum, pomegranate and citrus flavors converge. It's full and foamy on the palate.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Cuvée Engel Muscat (Alsace)
description: A totally luscious notion of tropical fruit on the nose is surprising: both pineapple and passion fruit appear. The palate is light and slender, fresh and precise, but the tropical richness persists. This is intriguing, delicious, dry and fun. The finish is whistle-clean.

title: Le Macchiole 2013 Scrio Syrah (Toscana)
description: This 100% Syrah wine opens with ripe black-skinned fruit, roasted coffee, leather and cedar aromas. The full-bodied, concentrated palate offers dried blackberry, espresso, white pepper and star anise flavors, bolstered by ample, polished tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Le Macchiole 2015  Bolgheri
description: Made of 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Franc, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah, this offers heady black currant, plum and clove aromas. The smooth, juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, tobacco and licorice flavors, with smooth, silky tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Donum 2014 Year of the Horse Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Spicy forest notes speak loudest in this wine, which has a quiet texture of tightly woven tannin and supportive oak. Complex and savory, its fruit is subdued, marked by wild strawberry and minty herb.
designation: Year of the Horse Single Vineyard

title: Antoine Moltès & Fils 2015 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: A note of reduction still clings to the nose. The palate, however, expresses lemony freshness and sprightly fruit, coated with a darker earthier aspect. The body is dry and concentrated and shows lovely easy freshness. On the finish the lemon wins out and finishes with clean-cut freshness.

title: Baker & Brain 2013 Escolle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Mineral aromas of gravel, graphite and crushed slate show on the nose of this bottling, leading into baked black plum and oak notes. It's a refreshing example from an appellation that tends toward richer, jammy styles. The palate offers raspberry and dried thyme flavors, with a touch of eucalyptus.

title: Beltane Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Drummond Block Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: A block-designated wine, this shows both purpose and focus, offering a linear expression of stony minerality, crisp lemon and peach. To complement that vibrant freshness, there is a fullness of mouthfeel and a nuanced gravelly texture.

title: Villa I Cipressi 2012 Zebras  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Forest floor, leather, tobacco and menthol aromas take shape in the glass. The palate is tense and vibrant, offering raspberry, pomegranate, licorice and espresso notes, bolstered by tightly wound tannins. Drink after 2020.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2013 Pinot Nero (Pomino)
description: This polished 100% Pinot Nero wine opens with enticing red cherry, baking spice, blue flower and balsamic notes. The elegant palate delivers red raspberry and wild strawberry fruit laced with cinnamon. It's nicely balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Capezzana 2012 Trefiano Riserva  (Carmignano)
description: Made of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this polished red opens with black-skinned berry and leather aromas. The smooth, medium-bodied palate evokes dried black cherries, cinnamon and white pepper, while fine-grained tannins provide elegant support. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Charles Sparr 2013 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Lifted notes of rose water and honeysuckle blossom rise immediately from the glass. They remain just as perfumed on the palate, clothing peach fruit in floral fragrance. There is a pleasantly bitter edge and just enough freshness to stand up to the opulent flavors. This finishes medium sweet and has a perfumed finish.

title: Château Bernadotte 2016 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Once owned by the Bernadotte family, rulers of Sweden, this estate is home to an impressive chateau. The wine is darkly concentrated and tightly packed with tannins, suggesting considerable long-term potential. There is a spicy character to the wine, along with notes of black plum skin. Try after 2025.

title: Château Cantelys 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a juicy wine based on firm, dry tannins. It is packed with black currant fruit, tight tannins and a crisp acidity in the aftertaste.

title: Château de Francs 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Made with the involvement of Hubert de Bouärd of Château Angélus as consultant, this wine is superrich and packed with dark fruit. Despite its high alcohol for a Bordeaux, it is balanced and fruity with tannins the are comfortably cushioned by the fruit and freshened by acidity. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Devise d'Ardilley 2016 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is firmly structured, with plenty of dark tannins, though it also has weighty fruit flavors to go with it. A fruity, juicy background should continue to develop well; try after 2023.

title: Château Duhart-Milon 2014 Moulin de Duhart  (Pauillac)
description: A ripe rich style of wine, with swathes of black-currant fruits and cushioned tannins, this second wine of Duhart-Milon is full bodied and deliciously rich. The fruit carries the wine with its smooth tannins. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Duthil 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Produced by the team from classed growth Château Giscours, this is a successfully ripe wine with smoothly integrated tannins. Cushioned by the ripe fruit, the structure is concentrated and impressive. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Château Maurac 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: This 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Merlot blend comes from an estate just north of Saint-Estèphe. It reflects the structure and density of that appellation. Bold, ripe and fruity, it will age well. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Paveil de Luze 2014  Margaux
description: Located in Soussans to the north of the village of Margaux, the estate is owned by the Luze family. This is a fine wine, full of black fruits and firm tannins. It also has a softer perfumed side that is typical of Margaux. With this combination and the ripe berry fruits, the wine is sure to age well. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Plince 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is concentrated while showing an opulence that comes from the rich Merlot. The wine is full of ripe black-plum flavors, dense tannins and great spiciness, all lifted by lingering acidity on the finish.
